Super Simple Intro To HTML

<span key="ee9c72cd939a4472aa27237bc367f948"><span offset-key="ee9c72cd939a4472aa27237bc367f948:0">What is HTML, CSS & JS and why do we need all three?</span></span>

<span key="78734fceb96142ea9a0c0c1e45620e48"><span offset-key="78734fceb96142ea9a0c0c1e45620e48:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">‚Äã</span></span></span>

## 

<span key="0861c89290664ee6925ee983f4ccf692"><span offset-key="0861c89290664ee6925ee983f4ccf692:0">Super Simple Intro To HTML</span></span>

### 

<span key="3ee80e73bb8e4f2a9afc02153966e10d"><span offset-key="3ee80e73bb8e4f2a9afc02153966e10d:0">What is HTML, CSS & JS and why do we need all three?</span></span>

<span key="9629117e588f4ba39f4e294d011cb471"><span offset-key="9629117e588f4ba39f4e294d011cb471:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">‚Äã</span></span></span><span slate-void="true" key="a3def2f79d104d2f87a21aa18fce83f7"></span>

<span key="1cfe11bebbfd428a9642b5514db5f0e5"><span offset-key="1cfe11bebbfd428a9642b5514db5f0e5:0">HTML stands for ‚ÄúHypertext Markup Language‚Äù. Basically, HTML is the structure for the website, words, bullet points, data tables, etc. CSS stands for ‚ÄúCascading Style Sheets‚Äù which means it‚Äôs the ‚ÄúStyle‚Äù it‚Äôs how to make your website look professional, and look visually appealing. JS is how to make your website actually \\\*\\\*work\\\*\\\*.</span></span>

<span key="7849984f99ef427cbe1bc6205727b91e"><span offset-key="7849984f99ef427cbe1bc6205727b91e:0">For example, if you created something like YouTube and one of the options you can watch videos, you used HTML for the title, you used CSS for the color/s, and you have to make it actually work! So when you click on it it will run the video. This is an example of the three programming languages working in unison to form an experience you‚Äôre already familiar with if you‚Äôre reading this‚Ä¶</span></span>

<span key="5c728668a8f24bc68ea5f94dcc9c2391">**I mean most likely‚Ä¶ unless you printed it because you hate trees.**</span>

<span key="f5316357d51142c39701eda867d71059"><span offset-key="f5316357d51142c39701eda867d71059:0">‚Äî‚Ää‚Äî‚Ää‚Äî‚Ää‚Äî‚Ää‚Äî‚Ää‚Äî‚Ää‚Äî‚Ää‚Äî‚Ää‚Äî‚Ää‚Äî‚Ää-</span></span>

## 

<span key="e826a72fc09d4504959b15d2723238f5"><span offset-key="e826a72fc09d4504959b15d2723238f5:0">What are Tags and Attributes?</span></span>

<span key="66529b5d02c143339bce8a00572f3ac3"><span offset-key="66529b5d02c143339bce8a00572f3ac3:0">Tags and attributes are the basis of HTML.</span></span>

<span key="abd72facd5184ce1a2890b5570c18d04"><span offset-key="abd72facd5184ce1a2890b5570c18d04:0">They work together but perform different functions‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääit is worth investing 2 minutes in </span>**differentiating the two**<span offset-key="abd72facd5184ce1a2890b5570c18d04:2">.</span></span>

### 

<span key="44097d9af3294f3f88f975aba382eff5"><span offset-key="44097d9af3294f3f88f975aba382eff5:0">What Are HTML Tags?</span></span>

<span key="764744be9da44f209913fdff023857d3"><span offset-key="764744be9da44f209913fdff023857d3:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">‚Äã</span></span></span><a href="https://html.com/tags/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e37b5a6cd6134a20b9c69d8580958e5a" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-3553_259-3554-237__"><span data-key="40f80ad554204832a15ba2e6ef264c13"><span data-offset-key="40f80ad554204832a15ba2e6ef264c13:0">Tags</span></span></span></a><span key="40dfea55a6ad4772939a862c391c7ec4"><span offset-key="40dfea55a6ad4772939a862c391c7ec4:0"> are used to </span>**mark up the start of an HTML element**<span offset-key="40dfea55a6ad4772939a862c391c7ec4:2"> and they are usually enclosed in angle brackets. An example of a tag is: </span>`<h1>`<span offset-key="40dfea55a6ad4772939a862c391c7ec4:4">.</span></span>

<span key="0f753742dccc4c83934e2f6e4a10ed20"><span offset-key="0f753742dccc4c83934e2f6e4a10ed20:0">Most tags must be opened </span>`<h1>`<span offset-key="0f753742dccc4c83934e2f6e4a10ed20:2"> and closed </span>`</h1>`<span offset-key="0f753742dccc4c83934e2f6e4a10ed20:4"> in order to function.</span></span>

### 

<span key="7bb3b97209374527a5a72d7ce2d35a27"><span offset-key="7bb3b97209374527a5a72d7ce2d35a27:0">What are HTML Attributes?</span></span>

<span key="d738efb004c14ea683462a1b6ee54de6"><span offset-key="d738efb004c14ea683462a1b6ee54de6:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">‚Äã</span></span></span><a href="https://html.com/attributes/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ab0fe6765b9249f8987d94695a084c6b" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-3553_259-3554-237__"><span data-key="618763582d974e4f97351ba5e96da72a"><span data-offset-key="618763582d974e4f97351ba5e96da72a:0">Attributes</span></span></span></a><span key="077d885f47a14fe9abd8dab145e4879f"><span offset-key="077d885f47a14fe9abd8dab145e4879f:0"> contain </span>**additional pieces of information**<span offset-key="077d885f47a14fe9abd8dab145e4879f:2">. Attributes take the form of an opening tag and additional info is </span>**placed inside**<span offset-key="077d885f47a14fe9abd8dab145e4879f:4">.</span></span>

<span key="ba2a52ff8319435c8d7d2a70d0909172"><span offset-key="ba2a52ff8319435c8d7d2a70d0909172:0">An example of an attribute is:</span></span>

<span key="d31cc2e5b211498bad4317dfc7c54d25">`<img src="mydog.jpg"                                         alt="A photo of my                                         dog.">`</span>

<span key="dd6f8d94371f43ebbc1afae2dd55825c"><span offset-key="dd6f8d94371f43ebbc1afae2dd55825c:0">In this instance, the image source (src) and the alt text (alt) are attributes of the </span>`<img>`<span offset-key="dd6f8d94371f43ebbc1afae2dd55825c:2"> tag.</span></span>

### 

<span key="f61ba1665fa34ede8b733e0c5fd42ed8"><span offset-key="f61ba1665fa34ede8b733e0c5fd42ed8:0">Golden Rules To Remember</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="dfc4334ae66246c28be1f4397590df6a"><span offset-key="dfc4334ae66246c28be1f4397590df6a:0">The vast majority of tags must be </span>**opened**<span offset-key="dfc4334ae66246c28be1f4397590df6a:2"> (</span>`<tag>`<span offset-key="dfc4334ae66246c28be1f4397590df6a:4">) and </span>**closed**<span offset-key="dfc4334ae66246c28be1f4397590df6a:6"> (</span>`</tag>`<span offset-key="dfc4334ae66246c28be1f4397590df6a:8">) with the element information such as a title or text resting between the tags.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="5dbde2e21c5344ecb6b0b85ff1cc2e45"><span offset-key="5dbde2e21c5344ecb6b0b85ff1cc2e45:0">When using multiple tags, the tags must be </span>**closed in the order in which they were opened**<span offset-key="5dbde2e21c5344ecb6b0b85ff1cc2e45:2">. For example:</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">3.</span>
    <span key="313844ae287f44f0b4daa1983d8b7da4">`<strong><em>This is                                                 really                                                 important!</em></strong>`</span>

<span key="b0471bae7df04f098065a1a525557d60"><span offset-key="b0471bae7df04f098065a1a525557d60:0">Let‚Äôs have a look at how CodePen works, firstly, you need to go to their website. After that, you must create an account. After you do that, You will see something like this</span></span>

## 

<span key="a35d20dd916e4645836580e119d04d16"><span offset-key="a35d20dd916e4645836580e119d04d16:0">How to get started</span></span>

<span key="499cc0bf25d84c0897428152031a7e0c"><span offset-key="499cc0bf25d84c0897428152031a7e0c:0">If you‚Äôre using Visual Studio Code, congrats! There is Emmet support built into VSCode, so you won‚Äôt need to install any extensions. If you‚Äôre working in Atom you‚Äôll need to install the Emmet plugin, which can be </span></span><a href="https://atom.io/packages/emmet" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="c11e20f0c54c4863b6eeee9fa90260cb" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-3553_259-3554-237__"><span data-key="54c8c7b6aeee4745af973b018a103fb9"><span data-offset-key="54c8c7b6aeee4745af973b018a103fb9:0">found here</span></span></span></a><span key="b7c47aa5d8c443ac9a5d6625bbc36b57"><span offset-key="b7c47aa5d8c443ac9a5d6625bbc36b57:0">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="54eae4629baa4bedbb3aae492556f88a"><span offset-key="54eae4629baa4bedbb3aae492556f88a:0">Basic Syntax</span></span>

<span key="a8dd214b98e34c4b8e6a7e042aed1749">***HTML Boilerplate***</span>

<span key="d17f935de22d4534b30bd9b7ba9ea8a5"><span offset-key="d17f935de22d4534b30bd9b7ba9ea8a5:0">If you‚Äôve been working in VSCode, you‚Äôve probably seen Emmet syntax highlighting when working in HTML documents. In my opinion, the most convenient Emmet shortcut is </span>***html:5***<span offset-key="d17f935de22d4534b30bd9b7ba9ea8a5:2">. This will create an HTML boilerplate, and fill out metadata tags in the head of your document.</span></span>

1

<span key="f3c2bd75634449769573f8d90b9af186"><span offset-key="f3c2bd75634449769573f8d90b9af186:0">html:5</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7" />

Copied!

<span key="ada9288938844bcc83843736dab0fe2b"><span offset-key="ada9288938844bcc83843736dab0fe2b:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">‚Äã</span></span></span><span slate-void="true" key="31380f2f07834fdabbc44bc3aa76e73a"></span>

<span key="f5a4cb3448f54444984b64102339329f"><span offset-key="f5a4cb3448f54444984b64102339329f:0">Emmet Abbreviation for different HTML boilerplates.</span></span>

<span key="070f135e21864fc3ba74680b85bb7d6c">**When you see the auto complete as pictured above you can hit tab to auto fill the boilerplate html document.**</span>

<span key="86fd3929be564c7aadbff083dca1625e"><span offset-key="86fd3929be564c7aadbff083dca1625e:0">That one small shortcut autogenerates all this metadata and head and body tags:</span></span>

<span key="0d224d72bdb940b5a7e9d0974bc03bf9"><span offset-key="0d224d72bdb940b5a7e9d0974bc03bf9:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">‚Äã</span></span></span><span slate-void="true" key="db77865e18de4cbebc4f626be5675fbb"></span>

<span key="cebd348a40b34f5f95956ebc242e758f"><span offset-key="cebd348a40b34f5f95956ebc242e758f:0">#### Here‚Äôs some slightly more advanced boilerplate for you to use as a starting point in your projects.</span></span>

## 

<span key="587313e6a3f546f9b4fbb6d5fd958de2"><span offset-key="587313e6a3f546f9b4fbb6d5fd958de2:0">HTML Language</span></span>

<span key="5f9d3713daeb47f284532b07904203c1">**Chapter 1: Formatting text**</span>

<span key="9becc5a4fdfd42eba4dfd53387c1f1d0">**Tags in HTML:**<span offset-key="9becc5a4fdfd42eba4dfd53387c1f1d0:1"> Tags are one of the most important parts in an HTML document. (We will get to what HTML document is after we know what tags are). HTML uses some predefined tags which tells the browser about content display property, that is how to display a particular given content. For Example, to create a paragraph, one must use the paragraph tags(&lt;p> &lt;/p>) and to insert an image one must use the img tags(&lt;img />).</span></span>

<span key="7bed1c0753ef41ba8883fe0b8637ab3c"><span offset-key="7bed1c0753ef41ba8883fe0b8637ab3c:0">There are generally two types of tags in HTML:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="3e3ee41bafca458d9dbb665549a06c4d">**Paired tags:**<span offset-key="3e3ee41bafca458d9dbb665549a06c4d:1"> These tags come in pairs. That is they have both opening (&lt; >) and closing(&lt;/ >) tags.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="b2eec9ca8b704ba98298f9b6c242f701">**Singular tags:**<span offset-key="b2eec9ca8b704ba98298f9b6c242f701:1"> These tags do not required to be closed</span></span>

> <span key="b39e4bfc14c54698ba11314bd9b1b64b"><span offset-key="b39e4bfc14c54698ba11314bd9b1b64b:0">i.e.</span></span>

1

<span key="d2331549d7674339842c6e5c1f986f2e"><span offset-key="d2331549d7674339842c6e5c1f986f2e:0">&lt;hr> </span></span>

2

<span key="00f291f089754642861f37c66b6d6a7b"><span offset-key="00f291f089754642861f37c66b6d6a7b:0">&lt;p> The tag above me is a horizontal line that doesn't need a closing tag &lt;/p></span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="e7b82d8cc87a4a5097065cf94359c274"><span offset-key="e7b82d8cc87a4a5097065cf94359c274:0">HTML tags have two main types: </span>**block-level**<span offset-key="e7b82d8cc87a4a5097065cf94359c274:2"> and </span>**inline tags**<span offset-key="e7b82d8cc87a4a5097065cf94359c274:4">.</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="fab3045973c340e69d539dac7a71ce0c"><span offset-key="fab3045973c340e69d539dac7a71ce0c:0">Block-level elements take up the full available space and always start a new line in the document. Headings and paragraphs are a great example of block tags.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="881867c7b0da4a13be3131504b44d978"><span offset-key="881867c7b0da4a13be3131504b44d978:0">Inline elements only take up as much space as they need and don‚Äôt start a new line on the page. They usually serve to format the inner contents of block-level elements. Links and emphasized strings are good examples of inline tags.</span></span>

## 

<span key="770b6a07d70845ad8ec226d2e161a2d0"><span offset-key="770b6a07d70845ad8ec226d2e161a2d0:0">Block-Level Tags</span></span>

<span key="2565a6b23429482dbf32e801dd872a61"><span offset-key="2565a6b23429482dbf32e801dd872a61:0">The three block level tags every HTML document needs to contain are </span>**&lt;html>**<span offset-key="2565a6b23429482dbf32e801dd872a61:2">, </span>**&lt;head>**<span offset-key="2565a6b23429482dbf32e801dd872a61:4">, and </span>**&lt;body>**<span offset-key="2565a6b23429482dbf32e801dd872a61:6">.</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="7225191b102448bbb3aa4dbb5eb12552"><span offset-key="7225191b102448bbb3aa4dbb5eb12552:0">The </span>**&lt;html>&lt;/html>**<span offset-key="7225191b102448bbb3aa4dbb5eb12552:2"> tag is the highest level element that encloses every HTML page.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="cf125b303760494294003348e7141a99"><span offset-key="cf125b303760494294003348e7141a99:0">The </span>**&lt;head>&lt;/head>**<span offset-key="cf125b303760494294003348e7141a99:2"> tag holds meta information such as the page‚Äôs title and charset.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">3.</span>
    <span key="8cfd7b05710d4c2ca94861fea356a204"><span offset-key="8cfd7b05710d4c2ca94861fea356a204:0">Finally, the </span>**&lt;body>&lt;/body>**<span offset-key="8cfd7b05710d4c2ca94861fea356a204:2"> tag encloses all the content that appears on the page.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="c72e7d44631d478c8e303019f9d68918"><span offset-key="c72e7d44631d478c8e303019f9d68918:0">Paragraphs are enclosed by </span>***&lt;p>&lt;/p>***<span offset-key="c72e7d44631d478c8e303019f9d68918:2">, while blockquotes use the </span>***&lt;blockquote>&lt;/blockquote>***<span offset-key="c72e7d44631d478c8e303019f9d68918:4"> tag.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="392ec54ecb394322be7cd2757bf97818"><span offset-key="392ec54ecb394322be7cd2757bf97818:0">Divisions are bigger content sections that typically contain several paragraphs, images, sometimes blockquotes, and other smaller elements. We can mark them up using the </span>***&lt;div>&lt;/div>***<span offset-key="392ec54ecb394322be7cd2757bf97818:2"> tag. A div element can contain another div tag inside it as well.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="451a0575da804b2b81377930b041e489"><span offset-key="451a0575da804b2b81377930b041e489:0">You may also use </span>***&lt;ol>&lt;/ol>***<span offset-key="451a0575da804b2b81377930b041e489:2"> tags for ordered lists and </span>***&lt;ul>&lt;/ul>***<span offset-key="451a0575da804b2b81377930b041e489:4"> for unordered ones. Individual list items must be enclosed by the </span>***&lt;li>&lt;/li>***<span offset-key="451a0575da804b2b81377930b041e489:6"> tag. For example, this is how a basic unordered list looks like in HTML:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="66914944c5ca4399bd3d4fdc2f28fcf4">**&lt;ul>**</span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="813fdadefe8b4a8a8eb358da17cdb7ee">**&lt;li>List item 1&lt;/li>**</span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">3.</span>
    <span key="9cc7924b78d243b884256bbd8924ba3d">**&lt;li>List item 2&lt;/li>**</span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">4.</span>
    <span key="b217620e45da47cb895bea3e71830fee">**&lt;li>List item 3&lt;/li>**</span>

5.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">5.</span>
    <span key="65291c44e2b7426493a6df092ad71f1b">**&lt;/ul>**</span>

## 

<span key="03c7e77c8fe04ded9eaa5ea173846c62">**Structure of an HTML Document**</span>

<span key="dc15ce1b36394777a7b73f206b6a18e9"><span offset-key="dc15ce1b36394777a7b73f206b6a18e9:0">An HTML Document is mainly divided into two parts:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="cef35028992442398088aefef79013c5">**HEAD**<span offset-key="cef35028992442398088aefef79013c5:1">: This contains the information about the HTML document. For Example, Title of the page, version of HTML, Meta-Data etc.</span></span>

<span key="db56743426284466a80c3a088a8d348f"><span offset-key="db56743426284466a80c3a088a8d348f:0">HTML TAG Specifies an html document. The HTML element (or HTML root element) represents the root of an HTML document. All other elements must be descendants of this element. Since the element is the first in a document, it is called the root element.</span></span>

<span key="7c6b37d956a34032bb3602fbe859a99b"><span offset-key="7c6b37d956a34032bb3602fbe859a99b:0">Although this tag can be implied, or not required, with HTML, it is required to be opened and closed in XHTML.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="d59b0f29411249d3b604f4aeba8b50e2"><span offset-key="d59b0f29411249d3b604f4aeba8b50e2:0">Divisions are bigger content sections that typically contain several paragraphs, images, sometimes blockquotes, and other smaller elements. We can mark them up using the </span>***&lt;div>&lt;/div>***<span offset-key="d59b0f29411249d3b604f4aeba8b50e2:2"> tag. A div element can contain another div tag inside it as well.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="68809d71015b4969910d6c1a27323a44"><span offset-key="68809d71015b4969910d6c1a27323a44:0">You may also use </span>***&lt;ol>&lt;/ol>***<span offset-key="68809d71015b4969910d6c1a27323a44:2"> tags for ordered lists and </span>***&lt;ul>&lt;/ul>***<span offset-key="68809d71015b4969910d6c1a27323a44:4"> for unordered ones. Individual list items must be enclosed by the </span>***&lt;li>&lt;/li>***<span offset-key="68809d71015b4969910d6c1a27323a44:6"> tag. For example, this is how a basic unordered list looks like in HTML:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="96adedd3c4344fbba3851dd1644b1be8">**&lt;ul>**</span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="119a7ddfe0ac43baba8637929215d320">**&lt;li>List item 1&lt;/li>**</span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">3.</span>
    <span key="60087f8209fa478ca0c903d1d40d8f22">**&lt;li>List item 2&lt;/li>**</span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">4.</span>
    <span key="63b2673c23264092928cae64efe21afa">**&lt;li>List item 3&lt;/li>**</span>

5.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">5.</span>
    <span key="1676265fb594468ab26439bcbae02349">**&lt;/ul>**</span>

## 

<span key="ab15e16fa6e94e09ae27722d931cb4ce"><span offset-key="ab15e16fa6e94e09ae27722d931cb4ce:0">Inline Tags</span></span>

<span key="6159646f89f14f17a56f652bc29a97c0"><span offset-key="6159646f89f14f17a56f652bc29a97c0:0">Many inline tags are used to format text. For example, a </span>**&lt;strong>&lt;/strong>**<span offset-key="6159646f89f14f17a56f652bc29a97c0:2"> tag would render an element in </span>**bold**<span offset-key="6159646f89f14f17a56f652bc29a97c0:4">, whereas </span>*&lt;em>&lt;/em>*<span offset-key="6159646f89f14f17a56f652bc29a97c0:6"> tags would show it in </span>*italics*<span offset-key="6159646f89f14f17a56f652bc29a97c0:8">.</span></span>

<span key="e57866f5c65c460d8dac21b6dda8ac78"><span offset-key="e57866f5c65c460d8dac21b6dda8ac78:0">Hyperlinks are also inline elements that require </span>***&lt;a>&lt;/a>***<span offset-key="e57866f5c65c460d8dac21b6dda8ac78:2"> tags and </span>**href**<span offset-key="e57866f5c65c460d8dac21b6dda8ac78:4"> attributes to indicate the link‚Äôs destination:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="d69f545739d344d2b19efe71cda7dc7b">**&lt;a**<span offset-key="d69f545739d344d2b19efe71cda7dc7b:1"> </span>**href=**<span offset-key="d69f545739d344d2b19efe71cda7dc7b:3">‚Äùhttps://example.com/"</span>**&gt;Click me!&lt;/a>**</span>

<span key="b6d50b68e09a4d33a89500bb926a7800"><span offset-key="b6d50b68e09a4d33a89500bb926a7800:0">Images are inline elements too. You can add one using </span>***&lt;img>***<span offset-key="b6d50b68e09a4d33a89500bb926a7800:2"> without any closing tag. But you will also need to use the </span>***src***<span offset-key="b6d50b68e09a4d33a89500bb926a7800:4"> attribute to specify the image path, for example:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="f4eebad0bd3d4d4683871b19fbf02804">**&lt;img**<span offset-key="f4eebad0bd3d4d4683871b19fbf02804:1"> </span>**src=**<span offset-key="f4eebad0bd3d4d4683871b19fbf02804:3">‚Äù/images/example.jpg‚Äù </span>**alt=**<span offset-key="f4eebad0bd3d4d4683871b19fbf02804:5">‚ÄùExample image‚Äù</span>**&gt;**</span>

### 

<span key="f84632013e2c4e6982db6ed2969b011b">**BODY**<span offset-key="f84632013e2c4e6982db6ed2969b011b:1">: This contains everything you want to display on the Web Page.</span></span>

1

<span key="346778b905854498808ebfa36d947ce5"><span offset-key="346778b905854498808ebfa36d947ce5:0">&lt;body></span></span>

2

<span key="1754d02497034584a72d13cd6b142297"><span offset-key="1754d02497034584a72d13cd6b142297:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">‚Äã</span></span></span>

3

<span key="618ab098bc7043f9989b01a5aaeab14c"><span offset-key="618ab098bc7043f9989b01a5aaeab14c:0">&lt;! ‚Äî Everything the user sees on the webpage goes here! ‚Äî ps‚Ä¶ this is a comment ‚Üí</span></span>

4

<span key="7d919b76edfc4e6d8f92f90662bc8d5f"><span offset-key="7d919b76edfc4e6d8f92f90662bc8d5f:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">‚Äã</span></span></span>

5

<span key="6bc0a2b6181e4c6b99b6c1e049035b11"><span offset-key="6bc0a2b6181e4c6b99b6c1e049035b11:0">&lt;/body></span></span>

<span key="ce96e86dfb7d405bb36ec0cbdb07afbb"><span offset-key="ce96e86dfb7d405bb36ec0cbdb07afbb:0">Let us now have a look on the basic structure of HTML. That is the code which is must for every webpage to have:</span></span>

<span key="6230dfe4733143499d8c25f9513858ce">***&lt;!DOCTYPE html>***</span>

### 

<span key="c85563da82db491881884096f62da3b4"><span offset-key="c85563da82db491881884096f62da3b4:0">Here is some boilerplate html you can use as a starting point:!!Every Webpage must contain this code.!!</span></span>

<span key="72773262faf5437680ea4bfeecd41916"><span offset-key="72773262faf5437680ea4bfeecd41916:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">‚Äã</span></span></span>

## 

<span key="0d5fd9af231d40718647800b116b24ba">**&lt;!DOCTYPE html>**</span>

<span key="49d62e1fd20e4def9c89ab97b7381562"><span offset-key="49d62e1fd20e4def9c89ab97b7381562:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">‚Äã</span></span></span>

<span key="e1ebf87238f14326bff74cdcdbd5f013"><span offset-key="e1ebf87238f14326bff74cdcdbd5f013:0">Below is the complete explanation of each of the tags used in the above piece of HTML code:</span></span>

<span key="2035213b940642c89505f31b7097ab45">**&lt;!DOCTYPE html>:**<span offset-key="2035213b940642c89505f31b7097ab45:1"> This tag is used to tells the HTML version. This currently tells that the version is HTML 5.</span></span>

> <span key="d41b3c3b00e04e12b19b86f97aa9881e">***&lt;html>*:**<span offset-key="d41b3c3b00e04e12b19b86f97aa9881e:2"> This is called HTML root element and used to wrap all the code.</span></span>

> <span key="cd73dae7779c4800a407fc3f21dc9e96">**&lt;head>:**<span offset-key="cd73dae7779c4800a407fc3f21dc9e96:1"> Head tag contains metadata, title, page CSS etc. All the HTML elements that can be used inside the &lt;head> element are:</span></span>

> <span key="2e1d8333be084a9894acf0fab792e8a6">**&lt;body>:**<span offset-key="2e1d8333be084a9894acf0fab792e8a6:1"> Body tag is used to enclosed all the data which a web page has from texts to links. All of the content that you see rendered in the browser is contained within this element.</span></span>

## 

<span key="54898832a44249a6b2424d7ae73068b1"><span offset-key="54898832a44249a6b2424d7ae73068b1:0">Bold Text:</span></span>

<span key="30d68e58493949d7afb4fa557d389c82"><span offset-key="30d68e58493949d7afb4fa557d389c82:0">&lt;b> </span>**this is bold**<span offset-key="30d68e58493949d7afb4fa557d389c82:2"> &lt;/b></span></span>

<span key="51f2008f23ef402ca329418f8f4f812b"><span offset-key="51f2008f23ef402ca329418f8f4f812b:0">&lt;strong> ‚áê this is for strong, emergency emotions.</span></span>

<span key="3ced54f873a84194b02ea90fdacde85c"><span offset-key="3ced54f873a84194b02ea90fdacde85c:0">\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_</span></span>

<span key="a025e6bbf205497389c97049492b5e21">**HEADING/S:**</span>

<span key="3d256460efb9484298a102001e4dd235">*6 types from largest(h1) to smallest (h6)*</span>

<span key="1b0698098a8a4964a226563ff0c539c0"><span offset-key="1b0698098a8a4964a226563ff0c539c0:0">&lt;h1> &lt;h2> &lt;h3> &lt;h4> &lt;h5> &lt;h6></span></span>

<span key="8ca094346dd243e989d244e457db7aa1"><span offset-key="8ca094346dd243e989d244e457db7aa1:0">\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_</span></span>

<span key="81bbd11067b44d4a8ffecacc2c488c28">**ITALICS:**<span offset-key="81bbd11067b44d4a8ffecacc2c488c28:1"> There are two ways to use it, the first one is the &lt;i> tag and the second one is the &lt;em> tag. They both italicize the text</span></span><a href="https://emojipedia.org/person-shrugging/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="99530d9410de49439cfc3484d8c91f1a" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-3553_259-3554-237__"><span data-key="24664117f90f4c7497965ad6913f2fea"><span data-offset-key="24664117f90f4c7497965ad6913f2fea:0">ü§∑</span></span></span></a><span key="07afef3007b34a009873e8d7146b13e7"><span offset-key="07afef3007b34a009873e8d7146b13e7:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">‚Äã</span></span></span>

<span key="fa722ecd8aee45c3add3764987038304"><span offset-key="fa722ecd8aee45c3add3764987038304:0">&lt;i> </span>*this is fancy text that‚Äôs too good to for us*<span offset-key="fa722ecd8aee45c3add3764987038304:2">&lt;/i></span></span>

<span key="312a0f171149488083ea60fc1de05f91"><span offset-key="312a0f171149488083ea60fc1de05f91:0">\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_</span></span>

<span key="40eae8ef2be046548e3386fa9381894b">**PARAGRAPHS:**<span offset-key="40eae8ef2be046548e3386fa9381894b:1"> In order to make Paragraphs, just add &lt;p>.</span></span>

<span key="f27667cec25f46cba4840e177d21a62c"><span offset-key="f27667cec25f46cba4840e177d21a62c:0">&lt;p> Hi there my name is Jason. &lt;/p></span></span>

<span key="3556cc4d929c4dd9bc971a3a1873d09a"><span offset-key="3556cc4d929c4dd9bc971a3a1873d09a:0">\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_</span></span>

<span key="620b3007fdb9498598d34da89fdd9240">**TITLES: not the same thing as a heading (which renders on the html page) but instead the title element represents the title of the page as shown in the tab of the browser.**</span>

<span key="8ea0a6a1c9944576bba6795f579c303c"><span offset-key="8ea0a6a1c9944576bba6795f579c303c:0">&lt;head></span></span>

<span key="c1a49bf618a043cd9972ed5a74318f6c"><span offset-key="c1a49bf618a043cd9972ed5a74318f6c:0">As such &lt;title>This is the title&lt;/title> it is always found between &lt;head> tags and not in the body of the page where all the content that gets rendered on the page is contained.</span></span>

<span key="4e2f81ea956a44ddb86d9df23aca0ff1"><span offset-key="4e2f81ea956a44ddb86d9df23aca0ff1:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">‚Äã</span></span></span><span slate-void="true" key="b337854203724f5381735fbbb3b6466a"></span>

<span key="e62569ab945f4c08877ddf691ec9caeb"><span offset-key="e62569ab945f4c08877ddf691ec9caeb:0">### Here‚Äôs a handy Cheat Sheet:</span></span><span slate-void="true" key="c428fa6310cd4f5396ba072a95f2b5bd"></span>

<span key="f4dd2c43c53541dca45ccec194518de9"><span offset-key="f4dd2c43c53541dca45ccec194518de9:0">Below I am going to Include a gist that contains html code that uses pretty much every tag I could think of off the top of my head‚Ä¶</span></span>

<span key="c10ed83895954e5aa670e9cd35814b6a"><span offset-key="c10ed83895954e5aa670e9cd35814b6a:0">If it‚Äôs not included here I promise you it‚Äôs seldom used by most webpages.</span></span>

<span key="6c83695fc9154283b5c49ea23c694588"><span offset-key="6c83695fc9154283b5c49ea23c694588:0">Below that I will embed an image of the webpage that it renders too‚Ä¶.</span></span>

<span key="bb890054283f41b69855affb5fe4d618"><span offset-key="bb890054283f41b69855affb5fe4d618:0">that super small text at the bottom is actually one giant button:</span></span>

<span key="092aa9f6650c4f0d894c6fcd5bf93862"><span offset-key="092aa9f6650c4f0d894c6fcd5bf93862:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">‚Äã</span></span></span><span slate-void="true" key="549f262a519e4ffc9af088708ba60104"></span>

<span key="e7ca65f74ca34108b58119dc056f1e98"><span offset-key="e7ca65f74ca34108b58119dc056f1e98:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">‚Äã</span></span></span>
